questions.question_text: Which hardware is required to support Fibre Channel storage?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Fibre Channel Host Bus Adapters (HBAs): Fibre Channel HBAs are PCIe cards installed in the server hardware (ESXi host) that provide connectivity between the server and the Fibre Channel storage fabric. These HBAs handle the communication between the server and the Fibre Channel SAN (Storage Area Network).

questions.question_text:
A vSphere operator discovers a storage problem with the following PDL error message:
Permanently inaccessible device :naa.1234567890 has no more open connections.
What should the operator conclude from this error message?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
PDL means it's over Johnny. APD is expected to return.

Selected Answer: C
C )
when a storage device becomes permanently unavailable

Selected Answer: C
The operator should conclude that C. A storage device has failed and is not expected to become available.

The Permanent Device Loss (PDL) error message "Permanently inaccessible device :naa.1234567890 has no more open connections" indicates that a storage device is no longer available to the host, and it is not expected to become available again. This error message is generated when the storage array determines that a disk or LUN is unavailable due to a hardware failure. The vSphere host will no longer be able to access the data on the failed device.

A. A storage device is disconnected, but it can be reconnected by a host reboot is not true as the error message specifically states that the device is "permanently inaccessible".

B. A storage device has failed and is expected to become available and D. A storage device is disconnected, but it is treated as a transient issue are also not true, as the error message specifically states that the device is "permanently inaccessible".
